definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: One US official at the time called this the "stupidest thing this country ever did".
sentences.chinese: 當時一名美國官員稱此舉“立國以來，蠢無前例”。

sentences.english: It will be an unprecedented occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 這將是史無前例的壯舉。

sentences.english: He called it an unprecedented illegal act.
sentences.chinese: 他說，這是史無前例的非法行爲。

sentences.english: Lin Dan, the giant of this era.
sentences.chinese: 羽壇史無前例，後無來者的時代巨人。

sentences.english: The affairs, and fates, of nations are intertwined as never before.
sentences.chinese: 各國的事務和命運史無前例地糾纏在一起。

sentences.english: The housing bubble was unique, and uniquely awful.
sentences.chinese: 房地產泡沫是史無前例的，而且又是獨特地可怕。

sentences.english: It is becoming urbanised on a scale unprecedented in history.
sentences.chinese: 它正在進行的城市化，其規模史無前例。
一個史無前例的富裕時代。

sentences.english: Yang said the cold spell had been "unprecedentedly long".
sentences.chinese: 楊說這次的冷空氣持續時間“史無前例的長”。

sentences.english: And anti-Semitism in Europe culminated in an unprecedented holocaust.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲的反猶太主義最終發展成一場史無前例的浩劫。

sentences.english: Moreover, Republicans will have unprecedented control over redistricting.
sentences.chinese: 還有，共和黨在重劃選區上將有史無前例的控制權。

sentences.english: Something unprecedented happened in China in late October.
sentences.chinese: 二零零八年十月，中國發生了一件史無前例的事情。

sentences.english: Figure 2 also shows a precedent for recent financial market strains.
sentences.chinese: 最近的金融市場緊張，在圖2中可以看到一個前例。

sentences.english: The scale of this crash, said officials, was unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 官員稱，這次撞擊的規模，是史無前例的。

sentences.english: It is unprecedented for prosecutors to discredit their own star witness.
sentences.chinese: 檢察官懷疑自己的主要證人，這是史無前例的。

sentences.english: Our comradeship and our brotherhood in war were unexampled .
sentences.chinese: 我們在戰爭年代同舟共濟的兄弟情誼是史無前例的。

definition: to have room to save a situation/margin for error (idiom)
see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]
pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3

definition: lit. Xiao's 蕭何|萧何[Xiao1 He2] governance followed by Cao 曹參|曹参[Cao2 Can1] (idiom)/fig. to strictly adhere to the policies of the predecessor/to follow precedent
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
